briefdescription.para: Handles exceptions caught within the Bison code.

detaileddescription.para:
<tt>true</tt>
if the parser should attempt error recovery.
<tt>false</tt>
if the parser should immediately abort.
This function is called whenever an exception is caught within Bison actions. Since exceptions cannot propagate through Bison code, the exception is saved (potentially with some extra context information) so that the caller of the parser can rethrow the exception.

If it is possible to recover from the exception, then the function returns true, and Bison enters error recovery state. At the end of the recovery, _gmx_selparser_handle_error() is called. If this function returns false, then Bison immediately aborts the parsing so that the caller can rethrow the exception.

briefdescription.para: Handles errors in the selection parser.

detaileddescription.para:
true if parsing can continue with the next selection.
std::bad_alloc
if out of memory during the error processing.
unspecified
Can throw the stored exception if recovery from that exception is not possible.
This function is called during error recovery, after Bison has discarded all the symbols for the erroneous selection. At this point, the full selection that caused the error is known, and can be added to the error context.

For an interactive parser, this function returns true to let the parsing continue with the next selection, or to let the user enter the next selection, if it was possible to recover from the exception. For other cases, this will either rethrow the original exception with added context, or return false after adding the context to the error reporter. Any exceptions thrown from this method are again caught by Bison and result in termination of the parsing; the caller can then rethrow them.

briefdescription.para: Propagates the flags for selection elements.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Root of the selection element tree to initialize.
Propagates the SEL_DYNAMIC flag from the children of sel to sel (if any child of sel is dynamic, sel is also marked as such). The SEL_DYNAMIC flag is also set for SEL_EXPRESSION elements with a dynamic method. Also, sets one of the SEL_SINGLEVAL, SEL_ATOMVAL, or SEL_VARNUMVAL flags, either based on the children or on the type of the selection method. If the types of the children conflict, an error is returned.

The flags of the children of sel are also updated if not done earlier. The flags are initialized only once for any element; if SEL_FLAGSSET is set for an element, the function returns immediately, and the recursive operation does not descend beyond such elements.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the method parameter data of SEL_EXPRESSION and SEL_MODIFIER elements.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection element to initialize.
scanner
Scanner data structure.
A deep copy of the parameters is made to allow several expressions with the same method to coexist peacefully. Calls sel_datafunc() if one is specified for the method.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the method for a SEL_EXPRESSION selection element.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection element to initialize.
method
Selection method to set.
scanner
Scanner data structure.
Makes a copy of method and stores it in sel->u.expr.method, and calls _gmx_selelem_init_method_params();

briefdescription.para: Creates a gmx::SelectionTreeElement for arithmetic expression evaluation.

detaileddescription.para:
left
Selection element for the left hand side.
right
Selection element for the right hand side.
op
String representation of the operator.
scanner
Scanner data structure.
The created selection element. This function handles the creation of a gmx::SelectionTreeElement object for arithmetic expressions.

briefdescription.para: Creates a gmx::SelectionTreeElement for a keyword expression from the parsed data.

detaileddescription.para:
method
Method to use.
args
Pointer to the first argument.
rpost
Reference position type to use (NULL = default).
scanner
Scanner data structure.
The created selection element. This function handles the creation of a gmx::SelectionTreeElement object for selection methods that do not take parameters.

matchType

args

rpost

briefdescription.para: Creates a gmx::SelectionTreeElement for "keyword of" expression.

detaileddescription.para:
method
Method to use for initialization.
group
Selection in which the keyword should be evaluated.
rpost
Reference position type to use (NULL = default).
scanner
Scanner data structure.
The created selection element. This function handles the creation of a gmx::SelectionTreeElement object for expressions like "z of ...".

memberdef.name: _gmx_sel_init_method

briefdescription.para: Creates a gmx::SelectionTreeElement for a method expression from the parsed data.

detaileddescription.para:
method
Method to use for initialization.
params
Pointer to the first parameter.
rpost
Reference position type to use (NULL = default).
scanner
Scanner data structure.
The created selection element. This function handles the creation of a gmx::SelectionTreeElement object for selection methods that take parameters.

Part of the behavior of the same selection keyword is hardcoded into this function (or rather, into _gmx_selelem_custom_init_same()) to allow the use of any keyword in "same KEYWORD as" without requiring special handling somewhere else (or sacrificing the simple syntax).

briefdescription.para: Creates a gmx::SelectionTreeElement for a modifier expression from the parsed data.

detaileddescription.para:
method
Modifier to use for initialization.
params
Pointer to the first parameter.
sel
Selection element that the modifier should act on.
scanner
Scanner data structure.
The created selection element. This function handles the creation of a gmx::SelectionTreeElement object for selection modifiers.

briefdescription.para: Creates a gmx::SelectionTreeElement for evaluation of reference positions.

detaileddescription.para:
expr
Input selection element for the position calculation.
type
Reference position type or NULL for default.
scanner
Scanner data structure.
The created selection element. This function handles the creation of a gmx::SelectionTreeElement object for evaluation of reference positions.

briefdescription.para: Creates a gmx::SelectionTreeElement for a constant position.
Creates a gmx::SelectionTreeElement for a index group expression using group name.

detaileddescription.para:
name
Name of an index group to search for.
scanner
Scanner data structure.
The created selection element. See gmx_ana_indexgrps_find() for information on how name is matched against the index groups.

briefdescription.para: Creates a gmx::SelectionTreeElement for a index group expression using group index.

parameterdescription.para: Zero-based index number of the group to extract.

briefdescription.para: Creates a gmx::SelectionTreeElement for a variable reference.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Value of the variable.
scanner
Scanner data structure.
The created selection element that references sel. The reference count of sel is updated, but no other modifications are made.

briefdescription.para: Creates a root gmx::SelectionTreeElement for a selection.

detaileddescription.para:
name
Name for the selection (if NULL, a default name is constructed).
sel
The selection element that evaluates the selection.
scanner
Scanner data structure.
The created root selection element. This function handles the creation of root (SEL_ROOT) gmx::SelectionTreeElement objects for selections.

briefdescription.para: Creates a root gmx::SelectionTreeElement elements for a variable assignment.

detaileddescription.para:
name
Name of the variable.
expr
The selection element that evaluates the variable.
scanner
Scanner data structure.
The created root selection element. This function handles the creation of root gmx::SelectionTreeElement objects for variable assignments. A SEL_ROOT element and a SEL_SUBEXPR element are both created.

briefdescription.para: Appends a root gmx::SelectionTreeElement to a selection collection.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection to append (can be NULL, in which case nothing is done).
last
Last selection, or NULL if not present or not known.
scanner
Scanner data structure.
The last selection after the append. Appends sel after the last root element, and returns either sel (if it was non-NULL) or the last element (if sel was NULL).

briefdescription.para: Check whether the parser should finish.

detaileddescription.para:
scanner
Scanner data structure.
true if the parser should finish, false if parsing should continue. This function is called always after _gmx_sel_append_selection() to check whether a sufficient number of selections has already been provided. This is used to terminate interactive parsers when the correct number of selections has been provided.

memberdef.argsstring: (const gmx::SelectionParserParameterList &params, int nparam, struct gmx_ana_selparam_t *param, const gmx::SelectionTreeElementPointer &root, void *scanner)
memberdef.name: _gmx_sel_parse_params

briefdescription.para: Initializes an array of parameters based on input from the selection parser.

detaileddescription.para:
pparams
List of parameters from the selection parser.
nparam
Number of parameters in params.
params
Array of parameters to parse.
root
Selection element to which child expressions are added.
scanner
Scanner data structure.
Initializes the params array based on the parameters in pparams. See the documentation of gmx_ana_selparam_t for different options available for parsing.
The list pparams and any associated values are freed after the parameters have been processed, no matter is there was an error or not.

briefdescription.para: Handling of intermediate selection parser data.

internal.para: The data types declared in this header are used by the parser to store intermediate data when constructing method expressions. In particular, the parameters for the method are stored. The intermediate data is freed once a gmx::SelectionTreeElement object can be constructed.
This is an implementation header: there should be no need to use it outside this directory.
